worklogs.comment:
nevi-me commented on pull request #3896: ARROW-4865: [Rust] Support list casts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3896
 
 
   This is a follow up from the initial cast kernel PR, and adds support for:
   
   * List<Primitive> to List<Primitive>
   * Primitive to List<Primitive>
   
   The only remaining expansion to the cast kernel will be temporal casts, then I think we'll be able to cover all cast use-cases.

sunchao commented on pull request #3896: ARROW-4865: [Rust] Support list casts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3896#discussion_r265663760
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/array.rs
 ##########
 @@ -131,7 +131,7 @@ pub type ArrayRef = Arc<Array>;
 
 /// Constructs an array using the input `data`. Returns a reference-counted `Array`
 /// instance.
-fn make_array(data: ArrayDataRef) -> ArrayRef {
+pub fn make_array(data: ArrayDataRef) -> ArrayRef {
 
 Review comment:
   can we make this `pub(crate)` instead?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

sunchao commented on pull request #3896: ARROW-4865: [Rust] Support list casts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3896#discussion_r265658918
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/compute/kernels/cast.rs
 ##########
 @@ -68,15 +72,53 @@ pub fn cast(array: &ArrayRef, to_type: &DataType) -> Result<ArrayRef> {
         (_, Struct(_)) => Err(ArrowError::ComputeError(
             "Cannot cast to struct from other types".to_string(),
         )),
-        (List(_), List(_)) => Err(ArrowError::ComputeError(
-            "Casting between lists not yet supported".to_string(),
-        )),
+        (List(_), List(ref to)) => {
+            let data = array.data_ref();
+            let underlying_array = make_array(data.child_data()[0].clone());
+            let cast_array = cast(&underlying_array, &*to)?;
 
 Review comment:
   nit: `&*to` -> `to`?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

sunchao commented on issue #3896: ARROW-4865: [Rust] Support list casts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3896#issuecomment-473368624
 
 
   @nevi-me : sounds good. I'll try to get the slice issue fixed ASAP.
   
   BTW: in the null case, how does the conversion from primitive array to list array look like: is a null value converted to `null` or `[null`]?

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3896#issuecomment-473381879
 
 
   I'll check what happens, my initial thought is a list with a single null, because I would expect `[null, null]` if I had an array with 2 values being cast

nevi-me commented on issue #3896: ARROW-4865: [Rust] Support list casts
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3896#issuecomment-473507569
 
 
   @sunchao I found the issue. When slicing an array, we count the nulls from a sliced offset bitmask, but we return the original bitmask without the offset applied. I've opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4914

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: This adds support for casting between list arrays and from primitive arrays to single-value list arrays
fields.summary: [Rust] Support casting lists and primitives to lists
